content.question:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 4 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follow. Column 1. x is 0. f of x is 0. Column 2. x is 1. f of x is 4. Column 3. x is 2. f of x is 7. Column 4. x is 3. f of x is 6." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function with selected values given in the table above. Which of the following statements must be true?
By the Intermediate Value Theorem, there is a value <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="f of c, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
By the Mean Value Theorem, there is a value <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="f prime of c, equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
By the Extreme Value Theorem, there is a value <math alttext="c" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> such that <math alttext="f of c, is less than or equal to, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>≤</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for all <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 5.2: Extreme Value Theorem, Global Versus Local Extrema, and Critical Points

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
